author: Mandy Mazliah
title: Pancake Day 2017: How to make really easy pancakes | Metro News
text:
Butter or oil for cooking 
Lemon wedges and caster sugar to serve (Picture: Mandy Mazliah) 
Sift the flour into a large bowl. 
Add the eggs and milk. (Picture: Mandy Mazliah) 
Whisk the mixture really well with a balloon whisk or electric whisk until all the ingredients are combined and there are no lumps. (Picture: Mandy Mazliah) 
Heat a little butter or oil in a small frying pan over a medium heat. 
Add a little pancake batter to the pan (around 2 tbsp worth depending on the size of your pan). 
Swirl it around the pan so it covers the base. 
Cook for around a minute then, using a plastic or rubber spatula, flip it over to cook the other side. (Picture: Mandy Mazliah) 
Remove the pancake from the heat and keep warm in a low oven while you repeat the process with the rest of the batter. 
Serve with the lemon and caster sugar.
